column4: i can't seem to kill a process with sudo killall or sudo kill -9
it's using all of my CPU
it says it's killed but it's still showing up in sysmon, and it's still using all of my cpu
that will cause data loss for that program
kill -s HUP shouldn't be trapable, it is zombied?
it's opened about 5 times, and one of the processes says uninterruptable. I'm not sure that I know what zombied means
uninterruptable means it is running something in the kernel, perhaps it is waiting on a socket operation that could take a few minutes
there are 4 other processes called rtorrent that dont say that, which i cant stop
collectively they're running my fast cpu up to 100% :p
hmmm googling for what to do
i've been doing some googling too. it looks like it might be a kernel bug?
doubtful people would notice a bug like that :) most likely these rtorrents are doing something like creating a big file or waiting on a socket that is taking the kernel a long time to return
i think it's a kernel bug, i just restarted.
he might not know what a VM is, this is his first time installing an dualboot os
